vaccineData.name: Yellow Fever Vaccine
vaccineData.description: Required for travel to certain countries in Africa and South America.
vaccineData.eligibility: Travelers visiting countries in Africa or South America where yellow fever is endemic.
vaccineData.precautions: Avoid in people with severe egg allergy or immunodeficiency; not recommended during pregnancy unless necessary.
vaccineData.administration: Single dose given as a subcutaneous injection by a certified travel health provider.
benefits: Required for entry in some countries

vaccineData.name: Typhoid Vaccine
vaccineData.description: Recommended for travelers to areas with poor sanitation.
vaccineData.eligibility: Travelers to parts of Asia, Africa, and Latin America where typhoid is common.
vaccineData.precautions: Postpone if currently suffering from fever or acute illness.
vaccineData.administration: Given as an intramuscular injection or oral capsules by a doctor.

vaccineData.name: Hepatitis A Vaccine
vaccineData.eligibility: All travelers to developing countries or areas with poor sanitation.
vaccineData.precautions: Delay if the traveler has moderate or severe illness with fever.
vaccineData.administration: Given as an intramuscular injection in the upper arm by a nurse or doctor.
benefits: Often combined with Hepatitis B vaccine

vaccineData.name: Japanese Encephalitis
vaccineData.description: Recommended for long-term travelers to rural Asia.
vaccineData.eligibility: Travelers spending more than a month in rural areas of Asia.
vaccineData.precautions: Avoid in pregnant women unless the risk of infection is high.
vaccineData.administration: Two-dose series given as intramuscular injections by a travel clinic.

vaccineData.name: Meningococcal Vaccine
vaccineData.description: Required for travel to the meningitis belt of Africa.
vaccineData.eligibility: Mandatory for travelers to Saudi Arabia for Hajj and Umrah pilgrimage.
vaccineData.precautions: Postpone if the person has a high fever or severe illness.
vaccineData.administration: Single dose given as an intramuscular injection by a doctor or nurse.

vaccineData.name: Rabies Vaccine
vaccineData.description: Recommended for travelers at risk of animal bites.
vaccineData.eligibility: Travelers engaging in outdoor activities or working with animals in rabies-endemic areas.
vaccineData.precautions: Avoid during pregnancy unless risk is high; postpone if sick with high fever.
vaccineData.administration: Given as intramuscular injections on days 0, 7, and 28 by a healthcare provider.

vaccineData.name: Cholera Vaccine
vaccineData.description: Recommended for travelers to outbreak areas.
vaccineData.eligibility: Travelers going to areas experiencing cholera outbreaks or with poor sanitation.
vaccineData.precautions: Delay if the traveler has vomiting, diarrhea, or high fever.
vaccineData.administration: Given orally as two doses at least 1 week apart by a healthcare worker.
